overview: This subject will address current topics in the area of physical climate science. Topics will vary from year to year depending on developments in the field but may focus on new research discoveries, areas of scientific debate, or recent climate events. The subject brings together knowledge from previous studies in climate science and related areas to discuss and critically analyse up to date knowledge of the field and its application to the world around us.

additional pre-requisite: This subject is a capstone requirement and should be taken towards the end of the course along with either the Climate Science Industry Project or Climate Science Research Project.

assessments.description: Participation in weekly two-hour workshops to discuss papers identified by the cohort. Students are assessed on active participation (e.g. taking part in discussions, asking and answering questions) in workshops. 500 words (equivalent). Hurdle requirement:. Attendance at 7 of 10 workshops is required.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 24 contact hours: 10 x 2 hours workshops + 1 x 4 hours group presentations

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
